studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Updated Schedule of Activities table with detailed visit windows and assessment timing
Physical examination timing clarified with reference to Section 8.2.1
Vital signs and resting O2 saturation requirements specified for SCCHN cohort
Laboratory assessment schedule updated including blood chemistry, hematology, coagulation, and blood typing interference test
Disease assessment imaging schedule specified for different tumor types (HCC, SCCHN, EOC, GBM)

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: Clarification of assessment schedules and visit windows for different tumor cohorts
Specification of cohort-specific requirements (e.g., Cohort E evaluation exceptions, SCCHN-specific O2 saturation monitoring)
Addition of blood typing interference test requirements due to isatuximab interference with blood compatibility testing

studyChanges.afterText: Physical examination: X (<7days prior to first dose) during screening D-14 to D-1
studyChanges.summary: Clarified physical examination must be performed within 7 days prior to first dose during screening

studyChanges.afterText: Resting O2 saturation for SCCHN: X at screening and throughout treatment phase
studyChanges.summary: Added resting O2 saturation monitoring requirement specifically for SCCHN cohort

studyChanges.afterText: Blood Typing Interference Test: X at screening D-14 to D-1, Cycle 2 Day 1 only, and before each transfusion
studyChanges.summary: Specified blood typing interference test schedule including requirement before each transfusion

studyChanges.afterText: Pregnancy test: every 30Â±7 days until 5 months after last dose of study treatment during survival follow-up
studyChanges.summary: Extended pregnancy testing requirement to 5 months after last dose during survival follow-up

studyChanges.afterText: CT/MRI (for HCC, SCCHN, and EOC): X (Weeks 9, 18, 27, and then every 12 weeks); Brain MRI (for GBM only): X (Weeks 6, 12, 18, 24, and then every 9 weeks)
studyChanges.summary: Specified different imaging schedules for solid tumors versus GBM

studyChanges.afterText: c evaluation not applicable for Cohort E
studyChanges.summary: Added footnote clarifying that certain evaluations on D8 and D15 are not applicable for Cohort E
